title: Document workaround for missing bootstrap_args in Custom Build Systems
body:
Todd Gamblin confirmed in the Slack #packaging room that this is a documentation bug; there is no `self.bootstrap_args()` function in [Phase and phase_args functions](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_systems/custompackage.html#phase-and-phase-args-functions).

As it turns out, the bootstrap phase is an ad-hoc phase only ever used by the CMake package, it's not anywhere in the spack python libraries:

```console
$ cd $SPACK_ROOT
$ find lib/spack/ var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/ -type f -exec grep -lFw bootstrap_args {} +
lib/spack/docs/build_systems/custompackage.rst
var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cmake/package.py
var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cmake/package.pyc
var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cmake/__pycache__/package.cpython-34.pyc
```

I see two options:

1. Keep the example mostly the same replacing `self.bootstrap_args()` with `bootstrap_args = ['--force']`.  The `configure_args` portion of the documentation should be sufficient to demonstrate the idea of phase_args.
2. Replace the bootstrap phase and bootstrap_args with another example.

I'll create a PR for option 1.
